intro: Spergularia macrocarpa, commonly known as the large-fruited sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, hairy stems and fleshy, lobed leaves. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers that bloom in early summer, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed habitats. Spergularia macrocarpa is a hardy perennial that is well adapted to arid and saline environments.
